results.title: If at first you don't succeed: you don't succeed [Colour version]
results.creator_credit: Peter Goodchild, Edward Goldwyn and BBC-TV
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Horizon”
If a mother does badly in bringing up her child in the first 5 years of his life, then the child has almost no chance of success in school. Child psychologists can now measure a new-born baby’s capacity for solving complex problems and they have found that the infant’s motivation is the sheer joy of solving the problems, but if the potential is not developed the damage is irreversible. The results of this research are having major implications for education.

If a mother does badly in bringing up her child in the first 5 years of his life, then the child has almost no chance of success in school. The results of this research are having major implications for education.

results.title: If a boy can't learn
results.creator_credit: Lawrence A Williams, Susan S Trout and Lawren Productions
results.brief_description: Looks at the problem of a boy with learning disabilities, who is sent to a Learning Disabilities Center for diagnostic workup and testing. A specialist confers with the boy’s teachers and together they improvise ways of teaching to his strengths in order to compensate for his disabilities and help him learn. Excellent for teacher training and can be valuable to parents.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Lawrence A Williams, Susan S Trout and Lawren Productions

results.title: Idomeneo
results.creator_credit: Christopher Swann, Trevor Nunn, RM Arts, Glyndebourne and BBC-TV
results.brief_description: Heroic drama in three acts with music by Wolfgang Amadeus Mozart, libretto by Abbate Varesco, and performance by the Glyndebourne Chorus (Chorus Director - Jane Glover) and the London Philharmonic Orchestra (Leader - David Nolan) conducted by Bernard Haitink. This made for television production stars Philip Langridge (Idomeneo), Yvonne Kenny (Ilia), Jerry Hadley (Idamante), Carol Vaness (Electra), Thomas Hensley (Arbace) and Anthony Roden (High Priest). This is director Trevor Nunn’s debut into opera but recent credits include “Cats” and “The Life and Adventures of Nicholas Nickleby”.

results.title: Idiot box
results.creator_credit: David Caesar, Glenys Rowe and Central Park Films
results.brief_description: Looking for the fast track out of suburban hell, two natural born losers scheme an impossible bank heist. They feel they have strong credentials, as they spend their days watching crime dramas on television and it’s about time they put what they’ve learnt into practive. Kev, angry, unemployed, and an accident waiting to happen gets the guns. Mick, slack, cynical and also unemployed, masterminds the plan. Cast includes Ben Mendelsohn, Jeremy Sims, Robyn Loau and John Polson.

results.title: Idi i smotri = Come and see
results.brief_description:
Come and see’ is a rare view of World War 2 from the Soviet perspective, based on real life experiences of writer Ales Adamovich. In 1943, the Nazis systematically decimated hundreds of Russian villages, slaughtering the inhabitants along the way. The horrors of the destruction are presented through the eyes of 13 year old Florya, who is adopted by a group of anti-German partisans, fighting in the woods of Byelorussia near the Polish border. When they abandon him, Florya is left to wander, gun in hand, on a dangerous return journey to his ruined village. Along the way he befriends a young girl Glascha, who accompanies him on a voyage representing his loss of innocence as a witness to wartime atrocities. When Flyora rejoins the partisans he is primed to mete out personalised and bitter justice for the destruction of his homeland and death of his mother. A haunting and powerful anti-war film, ‘Come and See’ is also a compelling coming of age story.

Credits: Director, Elem Klimov ; writer, Ales Adamovich, Elem Klimov ; photography, Alexei Rodionov ; music, Oleg Yanchenko ; editing, Valeriya Belova.
Cast: Aleksei Kravchenko, Olga Miranov, Victor Lorents, Liubomiras Lauiavicius, Vladas Bagdonas, Lyubomiras Lautsyavichyus.

results.title: Identity
results.creator_credit: Victor Lockwood, Michael Philps, BBC-TV and Open University
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Social Psychology”.
One of a series of a third level course from the Faculty of Social Science, Open University. The purpose is to provide insight into social behaviour and experience focussing on theories, findings and methods of social psychology. In this episode Norman Leighton, a young artist who grew up in the East End of London, talks about his youth and his art.

results.title: Identifying speech disorders: language (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Glen Howard, James Craig and Bay State Film Productions
results.brief_description: One of a series of films which portrays a type of deviant communication. It is limited to a descriptive presentation of language disorders which allow the individual instructor to discuss cause, treatment, prognosis etc., according to his own perspective.

results.title: Identifying Fire Hazards
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Safetycare”.
Identifying potential fire hazards is an extension of a basic good housekeeping policy - preventing fires by identifying and removing potential fire hazards should be regular practice in all workplaces. This video tells what to look for to make sure safety precautions such as fire doors are functioning properly and will serve their intended purpose in an emergency. Sprinklers, safe storage, controlling incoming goods, proper ventilation are some of the points.
